title: Greitens: We can look back with pride and forward with confidence 1 day ago
content: Outgoing Governor Eric Greitens published a lengthy Facebook post describing the work he and his administration accomplished Friday. (File)    NEW BLOOMFIELD —    Outgoing Governor Eric Greitens published a lengthy Facebook post describing the work he and his administration accomplished Friday.    The post comes about an hour before he formally resigns from office.    "We've changed the direction of Missouri," he writes.    "Our team accomplished more than anyone ever thought possible. And now, we can can look back with pride and forward with confidence."    The nearly 1,500-word post expands on 12 points: job creation, government interference, ethics, taxes, protecting law enforcement, prioritizing conservative principles , anti-drug initiatives, passing conservative reforms, Missouri foster care system, veterans issues, helping Missouri's rural communities and improving schools in the state. Said issues were Greitens' priority since he took office.    Greitens served over a year as governor.     "We made Missouri stronger-- because of you and your support," Greitens' post reads.    "Thank you, and God bless the state of Missouri."    Lieutenant Governor Mike Parson will become Missouri's top official for the remainder of Greitens' term.    Read the full post on the Eric Greitens
